availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to J. P. Roper. Father of W. E. Roper, Thomas J. Roper, E. M. Roper, Albert Roper, and James S. Roper. Married to Ann Uhles Roper in Fulton County, Kentucky, on April 3, 1860. Stepfather of Mary J. Uhles. Father of Allen Roper and John S. Roper. Farmer in Hickman County in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, pp. 11B-12A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 447.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 478B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Fulton County Marriages, Film #000321403, p. 124.
